summary: San Marino, officially the Republic of San Marino, is a tiny European country surrounded by Italy. It's the fifth smallest country in the world, with an area of about 23.5 square miles and a population of around 33,000. Though landlocked, it's close to the Adriatic Sea. The capital, City of San Marino, sits on Mount Titano. Named after Saint Marinus, a stonemason from what is now Croatia, it claims to be the world's oldest sovereign state and constitutional republic. Its government is unique, with two heads of state, called Captains Regent, elected every six months. San Marino is wealthy, with a strong economy based on finance, industry, and tourism.
title: San Marino
